Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: mickhanbury
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at madrid airport and were picked up by the shuttle this was very efficient, the hotel is very impressive inside but we had a bit of a wait because reception could only find one room in our name although clearly we had booked two.we then found out the pool was shut this was disappointing as it was one of the reasons we had booked this hotel also the cocktail bar was shut.The rooms were very good clean with a nice bed, breakfast was a feast which we enjoyed.the bus to madrid was outside and was convenient the only thing to watch is there are no shops or cheap restaurants near by and the food at the hotel is quite pricey for a family .We did eat at the restaurant once and we really enjoyed it.overall a good stay but disappointed with no pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing around”
Reviews.Author: JavierExtremer
Reviews.Content: Average hotel, a huge one, only nice if you stay there for one night. There's nothing but the highway in front of the hotel. The decoration it's a mix of styles i am not able to understand. Rooms are nice.

Reviews.Title: “A long way to the city centre...”
Reviews.Author: federicolui
Reviews.Content: The hotel is too big and too far from the city centre (30min bus+metro). Rooms are big and convenient but the cleaning isn't perfect. Sauna and swimming pool are nice. Staff not very helpful. Federico Lui

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel near Barajas Airport”
Reviews.Author: ney_spark
Reviews.Content: Good hotel located in the airport area. Large and comfortable rooms, free wifi available & airport transfer. A very good price-quality report. recommended for short stays (transfers through Madrid), far from city center (25-30 min by public transport).

Reviews.Title: “A+++ hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: With a free transfer bus from and to the airport, this hotel is huge, also its bedrooms. Very comfortable and clean. I would recommend it to anyone who needs to stay at a hotel before getting a plane or after coming back from it.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service - What's that?”
Reviews.Author: LeeTec
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel owing to a flight cancellation. It is reasonably close to the airport and offers a free transfer to the airport.......of sorts. This is a huge hotel which lacks any atmosphere. The rooms are clean and a good size but the bed was not made up ready for my arrival.Mini bar consists of 2 bottles of water?? Food - basic / plain / uninspiring. Reception - There was a delay on arrival but when dealt with was asked which transfer time I wanted in the morning to the airport. I stated 9am and was added to the sheet. In the morning arrived at front of hotel to join a huge queue. Minibus came and was quickly filled leaving over 20 people behind. I spoke to the receptionist who stated that its 1st come 1st on and I would have to wait until the next bus at 9.30. When I asked if I would get on this she shrugged her shoulders and said 'maybe' What is the point in asking you what time you want to transfer if there is no system for booking onto it!? Attitude was appalling. I don't know what customer service is in Spanish and clearly this receptionist had never heard of it If you want to stay in a huge impersonal hotel which lacks customer service then this is for you

Reviews.Title: “Be careful! Fraud. And yes it is bad!”
Reviews.Author: Marcellus12
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the worst level of incompetence. My Credit Card was charged twice!!!! Hotel pretended that my first Credit Card (Corporate one!!) was rejected and asked for a second card. When checking my statements they charged BOTH Credit Cards. Never happened to me in the past and I can certainly not be convinced that this was a coincidence. So watch your wallet!!! I'm still trying to sort this mess out with my credit card company but it's time consuming and cumbersome. I had to stay in this hotel twice and the rooms are of bad taste. Yes it is a big box targeting corprate events and poor people stranded from the airport because of cancelled flights. The hotel has an extremely unpersonal feeling to it and it has also a horrible smell everywhere. I could go on on Service and just the weird way the hotel is furnished. One of the strangest places is the lunch restraurant without any daylight etc. etc. there are so many examples that make a stay in this hotel very unpleasant. Many hotels around the Airport (ie. Silken Puerta America) offer a lot better value, nice modern rooms, stylish feeling!!!! So if you can avoid this hotel: do it!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: boeingking
Reviews.Content: Was here a few days why working from Madrid went to check in and they guy behind reception was so rude it was unreal to the point where my another guest says what's with his attitude? Same across all areas service needs improving! 1 guy on reception was great I came down to collect my breakfast and said just waiting on my captain & he reserved us a seats! Pool area is great used this everyday and the rooms are good.

Reviews.Title: “Best of its kind”
Reviews.Author: David T
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we only ever get to stay at the Auditorium for one night, either on our way to or from holiday in some far flung place. The price is right, breakfast endless, rooms and beds perfect, swimming pool very well maintained and last but not least the restaurant is excellent, this last visit was on our way home from Portugal on the 24th of june and looking for a good dinner they didnt disappoint , the set menu for two is top value at 50euros, we always choose fish, along with a good vino selection you cant go wrong. If travelling through Madrid and needing a stop over this place is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “O.K Hotel in the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: Iknimaya M
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here after booking it for a couple of nights due to its convenient location to the airport. Firstly, it is a 10 minute shuttle ride away and it's a lotto as to whether you get an English speaking/polite driver! 4/5 times, I appeared to have a losing ticket. As for the hotel, it is situated on a highway in the middle of nowhere and approaching it you can forget you're even in Madrid at all. Never the less, the entry hall gives a reasonably good first impression aside from a bizarre broken down car sitting in the middle and a driving range that seems to of been put in the middle of the bar area (?!). The reception staff were helpful and did speak pretty good English, after getting our key we made our way through what can only be described as an empty shopping centre and particularly when no-one is around it makes for an almost unpleasant environment. The rooms were actually decently sized and everything worked perfectly although the bath is somewhat questionable as it is about as shallow as my sink at home... The TV was somewhat limited in choice and unless you enjoy watching amusingly bad dubbing it's probably best to give it a miss. The bed was a little firm although a good size but the pillows were incredibly soft. The gym and swimming pool however were both in excellent condition and provided a pleasant view of the airport runway. The one key problem I have with this hotel is the fact that there is not a single restaurant within walking distance and as a result the hotel takes complete advantage and charges outrageous rates for food and drink. You need a minimum of 20 euros per person for a snack. The room service was one of the worst I've come across, and they messed up the only order I made 3 times due the fact that not a single person spoke English. In the end I had to contact reception and get them to sort it out. All for the sake of a 6 euro mug sized bowl of cereal. I would suggest as a result you make full use of one of the only decent perks of the hotel and use the breakfast buffet. Im sure this hotel would be fine for a business trip of one night only stay and your company was the one taking the hit. However if you are intending to go here for any other purpose or you have to pay for breakfast/evening meals I would strongly recommend otherwise. A few tips for those who do stay, if you want to get to the large shopping centre which is about 3 kilometres down the road (which has various restaurants and fast food outlets) you need to get the airport shuttle bus and pray the driver woke up on the right side of the bed that morning and ask him to stop, even if he appears to of completely ignored your request he most likely will of heard, do not be alarmed. As for getting into town, the easiest way I found was just getting the airport shuttle bus to terminal 2 and then getting a "touristico" ticket which allows you unlimited use of the metro network for that day (8 euros).

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel at decent price.”
Reviews.Author: Chad D
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice with my girl. Considering how lame European hotels are at outrageous prices, this hotel provides excellent 4 star accommodations for dirt cheap prices. The beautiful up-to-date room had a giant flat screen television, huge king size bed, luxurious robes and a very nice bathroom. The indoor pool allowed sky views and a warm place to swim in the cool winter months. Although difficult with public transport, this hotel is conveniently located to the airport and is a short drive to the city center. I've even found this hotel better than some Hyatt's that I've stayed in. Put in a Jacuzzi and I'd even consider it a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: aaronwileman
Reviews.Content: Was here for a conference. Had great service in some difficult moments. The staff were great to be able to manage everything I needed and even provide me some access directly to the local officials for help. The hotel is a bit dated and old and lacks a good restaurant, but with its bus will take you anywhere. Although it is a little too far out of the city near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Large but efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: corkboy2009
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for large IT conference. At first sight it looked like an old eastern block hotel, all concrete blocks. But over the week the place grew on me. Room was very comfortable. A/C worked. Shower good water pressure. Bed was a bit hard but fine. Service was good. No queues for check-in/check-out breakfast. Safe provided in room and also cloakroom to leave bag after check-out. The only downside is that this hotel has nothing within walking distance so you do end up with cabin fever unless you get a taxi / bus / metro into Madrid. We had some rip-off taxi fares. Some charged 20 euros to go in, others nearer to 40. None of them had a word of English and just shouted in Spanish. Anyway this has nothing to do with the hotel, but is just a general tip. Overall this is an efficient conference hotel, not a vacation hotel. ps. bar food is poor (avoid).

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport and very big!”
Reviews.Author: Vikash2011
Reviews.Content: Location to Barajas was the main reason for choosing this hotel, the airport is less than 10 minutes away. This is a huge hotel that feels like a small 'shopping mall' inside. Nevertheless it's clean comfortable and had good recreation and swimming facilities. The piano bar is nice and a good place to get a drink and snack and watch the world (inside the hotel) go by. They do have a piano and during my stay and elderly Spanish guy was playing a mournful,tune which I couldn't quite place, it was nice though! Nothing negative to say, You'll get what you pay for, it's an airport hotel and so expect it to busy with crew and travellers alike. Breakfast hall is just that, huge and feels like a school canteen, but the food is plentiful with a good choice and the staff are attentive. Just make sure you give them your room number before you enter, otherwise they'll chase you until they get it!! Look out for the snack bar, which is a huge room with tables and chairs and about 4 vending machines; coffee, snacks and water.

Reviews.Title: “Airport/Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Minesapintofgem
Reviews.Content: This is a convenient airport hotel which provides a free shuttle bus service. However, the hotel is built on an institutional model and it felt a bit like we were staying in an institution rather than a hotel. Really basic rooms, with no tea or coffee making facilities (there were vending machines on the ground floor!), which had hard floors and hard beds! OK for one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but a conference...”
Reviews.Author: Nikos K
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two nights attending a conference held there. The conference facility was excellent. A very large auditorium with state of the art equipment. The hotel is another case... The rooms are fair with quite old furniture and old fashion TV but quite spacious. Probably the largest bed I have ever sleeped in. The bathroom was also old fashioned but very clean equiped with everything someone would need. No signs of wear or malfunctions whatsoever. The lack of a balcony was a disappointment. The view from the window was in the middle of the square building my room was located so the curtains were shut during my entire stay. The hotel is extremely large. When I saw it upon arrival it reminded me of large square buildings built in the 70s. Vast front desk, it took me a 3 minutes walk to reach the elevator from the desk. The halls and corridors are heavily decorated with classic paintings on the wall and suddenly you have a modern art sculpture next to a bar with a classic piano which hasnt been played for a long time... Food and breakfast was fair, noce service though noone spoke english (only people the front desk did). The hotels bar on the ground floor is ok but the "disco" located one floor above was terrible and smelly... couldnt stay there for more than 10 seconds. The worst is the location. One must either pay a taxi to Madrid (25-30 Euro) or cross the highway, wait for a bus which takes you to the nearest metro station and then take two trains to reach the center of madrid (aprox 40mins to 1 hour). In conclusion dont choose this hotel for anything else than a conference held there...

Reviews.Title: “Overall OK Hotel for a Conference but not for vacation”
Reviews.Author: Moher
Reviews.Content: The Auditorium hotel is overall good but a very big and sterile it fine for business and conferences but I would definitely no pick it for a vacation or weekend trip to Madrid. The rooms are clean and spacious but do need a renovation soon. That bathroom is definitely dated and in my room the window did not properly close anymore what in an airport hotel can be a bit noisy. Again overall the hotel is OK but really could use some perk up and renovation

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in a nice place...”
Reviews.Author: fglawihio
Reviews.Content: We were put up in this hotel after our flight from Mardid to Washington D.C. was diverted back to the airport. We stayed one night under ditsressing conditions. Over two hundred people checking in all at once did not seem to be a problem for the front desk staff. We were quickly given a room and a voucher for dinner and breakfast the next day. The hotel building is outstanding with a real luxury feel. The dinner and lunch was buffet style but had anyting you could ask for including wine. The rooms are very new and spotless. ( I wish they had a few english speaking stations) The wake up call was on time and we were checked out with no hassles. I would recomend this hotel to family and friends who are going to Madrid.... Liam & Colleen New York

Reviews.Title: “Too big too noisy”
Reviews.Author: dqsmaine
Reviews.Content: Flight back to IAD was cancelled, United booked rooms at this hotel. Staff at the front desk is more unfriendly than friendly. Rooms are mediocre, very noisy, you could hear everything from abutting rooms. Buffet for lunch and dinner was arranged, food was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “best buy!!!”
Reviews.Author: antonio v
Reviews.Content: Clean and silent. Excellent food and staff. Big windows and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here when plane delayed”
Reviews.Author: Mollydancer407
Reviews.Content: Our plane was delayed at Madrid and LAN put us up at this hotel overnight. There were 200 passengers from our flight and so obviously a long queue to check in but we were dealt with quickly. Our room very comfortable. Hotel very modern from outside but looked old inside and we loved the grandfather clocks on display. We were given dinner, breakfast and lunch and the meals were excellent. All buffet so could have as much or as little as you wanted. The staff were very helpful. A courtesy bus took us too and from the airport so couldn't have been easier.

Reviews.Title: “Just for shirt biz stay”
Reviews.Author: Brama69
Reviews.Content: Not exciting. Lot of space, lack of personality. Inconsistent style. Room right enough, bathroom too old.

Reviews.Title: “When in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: cmegoaway
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a convenient hotel in Madrid for an overnight layover. Several friends had suggested this hotel so I was sure the experience would be pleasant. I arrived on a Ryan-Air flight (terminal 1) from the Canary Islands and after waiting 45 minutes on luggage, made my way to the hotel bus waiting area. I estimate the wait to be no more than 7 minutes before the bus arrived. Nice and roomy, with a very helpful driver! When we arrived at the hotel, there were only a few in line to check-in and this was a VERY fast process. Mere seconds and off to the room. Big hotel, ask for a room close to the elevator! The room is the most modern I have seen in Europe in years! Complete with everything needed for a single night or lengthy stay. From comfortable furniture to quiet surroundings, they seem to have thought of everything. I gave this hotel a "very good" instead of an "excellent" because of 2 small issues. They have internet available through a wired network connection instead of WiFi (they have wires available at the front desk) and the sheets were rough to the touch (towels were very soft though). The return trip to the airport on the following day was on time and just as uneventful as the day before. I would recommend this hotel to business or leisure travelers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place for a Conference — otherwise NOT a good choice!!”
Reviews.Author: NCWorldTraveler704
Reviews.Content: Hotel Auditorium Madrid I’ve just completed a 6-night stay at the Auditorium Hotel, where I was presenting at a conference. The hotel is directly across the street from the airport, but due to the size of the airport’s grounds, it was actually a 15 Euro taxi ride from the airport PLUS a 7 Euro surcharge because you were at the airport. The hotel offers a free shuttle, but I had no idea where to wait for it or how to summon it. You might want to call the hotel in advance of your trip to ask about the shuttle. I did take the shuttle back to the airport, which was VERY nice. Check in was a BREEZE – easily the fastest check in experience I can remember in years! The hotel is absolutely massive — reportedly the largest hotel in Europe! Guestrooms are built around a series of four “blocks” or towers, each with a central atrium – and the public spaces are extremely wide and voluminous. One would easily wonder why so much space is allotted to hallways and open spaces UNTIL you encounter a group like the thousands of multi-level marketers attending a rally on my arrival day. The place was just jammed with people. Once they left, the main floor of the hotel was a ghost town! Internet is free and quite fast. There is a rather well equipped gym and an indoor/outdoor pool. My room was very large with a big window that opened (even though the sign on the window says they can’t be.) The floors in the main room are laminate and marble in the bathroom. There’s a fridge in the room that had two complimentary bottles of water that were replenished every day. My only complaint is that the bed was rock hard — which just isn’t my personal preference. Actually I do have another complaint. There are no irons or ironing boards in the rooms – and you CANNOT request one from housekeeping either. The ONLY option you have is to use the hotel’s laundry service, which charges 6 Euro to iron a shirt!! If you’re going to market yourself as the largest conference hotel in all of Europe, you really do need to provide business travelers with the amenities they need – and that includes an iron and ironing board, preferably IN your room! The breakfast buffet was included in the price of the room and had everything you could want for breakfast, served in a MASSIVE dining room. There is ZERO individual service provided by the wait staff, so don’t expect to get anything other than what is offered. I also had the dinner buffet FIVE evenings. At a flat rate of 25 euro including tax and tip, you get a very wide assortment of salads, vegetables, desserts and hot dishes AND a bottle of their house wine, which was just delicious! There’s nothing remarkable about the food, but it was decent and tasty — and there’s really not much variation from one evening to the next. I didn’t try the main restaurant, since the buffet was a much better deal — but I did grab a sandwich for lunch in the piano bar area, and it was quite good. CONSIDER YOURSELF WARNED – There is ABSOLUTELY NOTHING in the area of the hotel you can walk to, so unless you want to take a taxi into Madrid (about 25 Euro each way, 20 minutes travel time) or public transportation (a bus in front of the hotel to the subway station) that takes about an hour total for a fraction of the price — you are STUCK at the hotel. This is most certainly NOT a good choice of hotel for people that are here to see the sights of Madrid, but for a conference, it was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travel & International Fair”
Reviews.Author: PORTAexpresso
Reviews.Content: We were hosted at Auditorium Madrid Hotel during 2 days for the visit to the Tourism Fair and the human resource were always available to help. 2 daily transfers with the fair, transfers to Barajas Madrid Airport during all day till 1am . Thanks to contribute for the success of our business travel . Also a special thanks for the advice of restaurants to dinner during night in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “With a car and GPS and a morning flight, it s a worth hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yupingdresden
Reviews.Content: We found it easily with GPS at 22o'clock, still many people at the door.think it's a busy hotel because the location like an airport hotel. The staff is so busy, it took only one min fulfill all check in. Room is big and good organized.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable airport accomodations with excellent breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: FilipinoBusinessman
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel with a lot of interesting art pieces. It is huge, with decent sized rooms and a very good breakfast buffet with lots of fresh fruits, cold cuts cereals, hot food. More than my heart's desire. Rooms and bathrooms are very clean and you can walk barefoot in the rooms. Inconvenient for transit to the city or to any form of shopping or convenience store (1 km to the nearest store along a oad with no sidewalk). It's a bit of a ride to the airport and you have to reserve the airport shuttle way ahead of time. Good value and the inner rooms do not have highway noise.

Reviews.Title: “wrong location,no tea”
Reviews.Author: COYDRCOY
Reviews.Content: the buiding and the rooms and the meeting facilities are ok,can't find an english speaking waiter just the seniors can help but even they couldn't make anybody bring tea for the breakfast during a full 9 minute !!!!!! I had to protest them standing by the empty teapots and speaking high "une momento-due momento-tre momento......."and they rushed for lipton bags . The other problem was the "mafia taxis",they just take the long highway road and I believe we came to madrid via valencia for a double bill.the hotel is located in the middle of nowhere,not an airport hotel,not a city hotel,just far away from civilisation,please take this hotel out of madrid hotels list.

Reviews.Title: “Industrial, fine for conference, but far from restaurants, town”
Reviews.Author: drsh99
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience Madrid at all, stay in the center of town, not at this hotel. The Auditorium is an enormous business/conference center hotel near the airport. It is far from Madrid and you cannot walk to any restaurants from the hotel. The hotel restaurants are generic, okay food, very expensive. The rooms are comfortable and very clean, although staying there on a weekend before a conference, when the hotel was fairly empty, the darkened hallways, echoing lobbies, and scarce staff made me yearn for the cozy, homey feel of the hotel in the Shining. The Auditorium is excellent for a conference or training, however, with efficient service, plenty of space, a good buffet for all three meals, and decent pricing. Internet was fast and available for free in-room. The fitness room is small for the size of the hotel and stuffy, although it was never crowded during my 5 days there. The pool was heavenly, though, and stayed open until 10pm. If you don't need atmosphere and don't want to have any uniquely Madrid or Spanish food or culture, this hotel is fine. Otherwise, stay at one of the many great choices in central Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Run down hotel in a terrible location”
Reviews.Author: Doofler
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 3 nights for a large conference. The hotel is in a bad location €20 to the airport and €25 to the city one way. Public transport options would take ages and would involve buses and metro and would take over an hour to get into the city. The staff at the hotel were very curt and not friendly, kind of typical of all the service I received in Madrid. The rooms were a good size but tired, the matteress was very old and springy and the furniture was dated. The pool was also old and the changing rooms were moldy particularly in the shower area. The hotel breakfast for a hotel of this size (supposedly the largest in Europe) was terrible, the food lacked imagination and the hot food was dire. In summary the hotel feels shabby and outdated, it is expensive for the quality of service and accommodation that you get and I would not understand why anyone would choose to stay here unless for attending a conference as in my case.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is ok but not at all worth the price. Avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: jepoirrier
Reviews.Content: This hotel has 4 stars and is said to be one of the biggest in Europe. Apart from the size, it doesn't deserve more than 2 stars and I advise you to avoid it is you can. I stayed there for business reasons: I was attending the congress downstairs. But apart from that, I wouldn't go there again. The Auditorium hotel is located near the Madrid airport. But you still need at least 20 minutes by taxi or by the (free) shuttle service to get there. It is located in the middle of nowhere, the only things you can do is either stay in the hotel or take a taxi to go to Madrid. In the hotel, you'll find it gigantic, for sure. Even the rooms are big (compared to other 2 or 3 stars hotels). But it's also cold and the service is minimal (except at the reception desk). There is an expensive restaurant where food is pricey and not even good ; service is slow and impersonal. There is a bar where the service is even slower and you won't expect any good food there. The bar is located in the main hall itself so it's very cold in autumn. The only good thing about the bar is the piano player (but he looks so sad, alone in his corner). Breakfast is expensive (12€) given the relatively poor choice and the absence of service ; tip: hot meals are located at the very end of the breakfast hall. Even for the congress, the service was minimal (e.g. waiters starting to take away cookies and coffee before the break was over - this is very cheap). As I wrote above, rooms are big. You have a big bathroom with everything you could need. There is a huge cupboard with a safe (big enough for a 15" laptop). And there is plenty of space around the double-bed and the desk with two chairs. Big TV screen also (but didn't switch it on during my stay). Everything is fine for a 2 or 3-stars hotel, not more. The cleaning service is good however. And there is free internet access (free cable provided by the reception) In summary, it's not bad but avoid if you can. The only two situations where I can see people staying there are when they are obliged to stay there: either because there is an issue with their plane or because there is a congress in the very same hotel. In all other cases, avoid and your experience of Spain / Madrid will be much better.

Reviews.Title: “Big conference hotel, on industrial estate 20 mins from airport, could be much better”
Reviews.Author: combebelle
Reviews.Content: This is neither in Madrid or near the airport and its 20 to 35 euros to get to either by taxi, the airport shuttle is well erratic. Meeting rooms in total can accomodate a meeting of 3000 delagtes, and buffet food and liquids are good quality and logistcs work in the big open spaces. But, the bedrooms are as cold as they are big, and guest noise travels, trucks arrive early outside, The restaurant food is average the Bar food alternatives are old cold and dire. Facilities ok but service standards and linguistic skills could be much stronger. Would use for a meeting but advise that no delegates stay in this hotel, which makes it a poor choice for a congress.

Reviews.Title: “The image is spoiled with 0-zero Customer Service !”
Reviews.Author: Krockz77
Reviews.Content: just got back from long trip in spain.. Had a 1 night stay to prepare for my flight back early morning the next day. We arrived around 6PM, there was a huge event at the moment. I waited for the check in, i lady (blonde), was very helpful, the other lady (black/brunette kinda wavy long hair) was EXTREMELY RUDE!, i asked about our luggage for the help of a bell boy, she answered me "u can put here, all are buzy , we will send later", ill said ok ill wait to be send to the room cos i have 5 huge luggages with me. Imagine, i waited from 5PM to 9PM and no one send my bag, at the end of the day me and my friend have to go back downstairs and take our luggage one by one and no one is helping us .. imagine how we felt , and with us during our travel is my mom and mom';s friend age above 60!, at least have some courtesy to ring our room and say u guys cant send the luggage., not just keeping quiet about it. Its far from madrid town anyway, therefore its not a hotel i would recommend. In the future, this will not be my choice anymmore. Rooms spacious but service sucks..and it sucks big time!

Reviews.Title: “The very good life”
Reviews.Author: bpkagfmt
Reviews.Content: Overal the hotel was great and for the most part we had a great stay at the Auditorium. I would recommend it to anyone as long as they didn't get a room directly under the tennis court on the roof. The reception desk was outstanding and very patient with us English speakers. They were very helpful with advise on the bus and metro and treated us very well. They also helped me fax some business papers back to the states and they were very happy to do it for me. The common areas are nicely arranged and always clean. The internet computers and the free internet in the room (take a cable) were a big reason we chose this location and we weren't disappointed. The pool area was very nice and even on a chilly day it was quite comfortable to swim or lay on a lounge under the retracting roof. The room was very nicely decorated with a very upscale feel. The beds were a treat to sleep on and for the most part it was quiet. When the maids cleaned the room they did a very good job and it was spotless when they were through. There were a few times that we asked them to come back in a few minutes as we were getting ready to leave and they just didn't clean the room that day. Other days they had no problem coming back to accomadate us so it seems like they just decided not to do it. There is a large mall with food and shopping less than 10euros away by taxi and there were always taxi's waiting. The bus stops are an easy walk away and the fair was 1.60euros to the metro station and you could go one way to anywhere on the metro for 1.60euros more. So for for 6.40euros you could go to just about anywhere in the city and back to the hotel. Ask the front desk for the instructions on which busses stop at the Auditorium stop before you go. We had one meal at the hotel restaurant that was very good but rather expensive. We chose to eat out before coming back to the motel for the day which probably paid for our transportation for the day. There really isn't anything with in easy walking distance to the motel. As you could probably figure our room was directly below the tennis court which wasn't a problem most of the time. However a few nights they had some pretty aggressive players running, jumping, yelling and beating their rackets just a few feet above our heads while we were trying to sleep. The court is also in a metal cage and every few minutes someone would run into that which was especially annoying. They were shaking our room so hard that things on our night stands and TV stand were rattling. I called reception to complain since we had to be up early the next morning to catch a flight and got no answer. We called another number they listed and got someone that said they would take care of it but 20 minutes later nothing had changed. We called a number that was suppose to be the manager and once again we were told that it would be taken care of. Almost 30 minutes later at almost 11:00 PM the noise finally stopped. I can't say if they finally quit or if someone from the hotel actually went and told them to quit but it shouldn't have taken that long. For a hotel that caters to business people I would've expected the tennis courts to close at the same time the pool closed (9:00 PM). Our only complaint of the week we spent there but the hotels slow response to our complaint didn't set well with us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cpsimons
Reviews.Content: We were sent there by Aerolineas Argentinas, as the plane we were supposed to fly with had some malfunction. The hotel picked us at the airport and brought us back - about ten minutes to Terminal 1. The reception staff worked very hard to satisfy at least 300 ill-tempered guests, and did it efficiently and without losing time. It is a very big hotel, they say of themselves "the biggest hotel in Europe" but everything worked fine. The rooms are very spacious, just like the bathrooms. We had dinner, breakfast and lunch there and everything in the buffet was of very good quality and the service was friendly. I would reccomend it for a stopover between flights.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Airport - for business and overnight near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Guckster
Reviews.Content: A large, comfortable hotel near to the airport, but no where near the city. If you are travelling to Madrid itself, this is not a good choice. If you need somewhere near the airport, a good option. Prices in the restaurants were quite high though, best to go to one of the restaurants up the road!

Reviews.Title: “I wish I can give this hotel 0/10!!”
Reviews.Author: skuwaiti
Reviews.Content: I can hardly find any advantages! It is a huge hotel .. well, really huge! not sure if that was an advantage though! May be the only advantage was their good breakfast buffet. Now to the real business: First, it is an isolated airport hotel, with no shuttle services to Madrid. A taxi ride to Madrid will cost you 40-50 Euros for a round trip! I arrived with on the 13/10. The reception desk staff were not very welcoming or courteous. The guy who took us to our room got us into another person's room by mistake. Just imagine what would the situation be if that guy was in the middle of "something important"! For 3 consecutive nights, when i arrive at the hotel after a long day in Madrid, i find the access card to my room not working! The first day i managed to call someone from the front desk and they sent somebody to help, but on the following day, the hotel landline was disconnected! Yes .. DISCONNECTED! The fridge was empty, except for 2 small bottles of water. There are no bathrobes. No movies to choose from even to pay for movies! The cleaning staff do not change bed sheets, and they dont provide shampoo or soap every day. calling front desk from your room was a disaster, as they would hang us on you or make you wait endlessly. they then tell you to call 8495 for room service! When you get to the room service, they tell you that they will need to charge you 3 euros for bringing you glasses/cups and ice. And yes, there were no glasses/cups in the room! Simply .. a nightmare .. not a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Huge, Impersonal, OK”
Reviews.Author: lifesaver1
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a massive, soulless, airport hotel that might remind you of the movie, “The Shining,” this one is for you. You can certainly feel very lost in this place. It’s about a 15 minute drive from the Madrid airport with a free shuttle. My room was quite spacious and well appointed, with wi-fi and a television with many channels. There is a very large, though otherwise bare, workout room with free weights and various machines, particularly numerous treadmills. It’s just a room, without a lot of character, but if you are serious about working out, it’s pretty good. There is a small lap pool about 20 meters long. You can do laps with a lot of turns. Like most airport hotels, the restaurant selections are limited and quite expensive. There was a sit-down restaurant, but the most economical option appeared to be a buffet, for 25 euro. It was OK, but overpriced for what was offered, situated in a room that could comfortably serve hundreds of people. When I was there, the hotel was perhaps 1/10 full, if that. This was not an intimate environment. There are grand areas in this hotel, with very large, old hallways. The hotel is reasonably well maintained, but some aspects are really old. For example, computer monitors in the "business center" were old style and the computers pretty limited. It hardly qualifies as a business center, but you can print out a boarding pass or check your email. There were only four stations and they were all full, even though the hotel had very few people. There is no way this is even remotely adequate capacity if the hotel were full. The bottom line here is that this place is dated, huge, and manifestly impersonal. In retrospect, I’d have preferred a smaller Holiday Inn Express or Hilton, which were nearby and appeared much newer/smaller. I do not know the relative costs or what those hotels might have had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Dimi D
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for bussiness travelers and meetings. Clean, comfortable and near the airport location.

Reviews.Title: “Huge and close to airport”
Reviews.Author: AlohaTrave1er
Reviews.Content: By being close to the airport, it is quite far from town. I had to get a shuttle to the airport and then catch an airport bus to town. Getting back from Madrid late at night by cab cost about 40 Euros. Clean and huge rooms and since they figure you are stuck here, there is an amusement games room as well as an indoor golf simulator.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight hotel close to barajas airport”
Reviews.Author: kattis1964
Reviews.Content: Close to baracas and free transfer included in the price. Rooms very clean and comfortable. Biggest hotel in europe. Would'nt stay here to spend time in madrid but as an overnight hotel it's perfect. Nothing to do in the area and no restaurants close. Possible to order snacks in the bar but expensive. Very nice breakfast buffé, also including hotfood and a marvellous cookiebuffét. Really worth it's price! Small, but nice and clean pool.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful”
Reviews.Author: Hvilsted
Reviews.Content: When you are put up at a hotel by an airline responsible for a missed flight, you do not expect much. But sadly, this hotel did not even satisfy low expectations. It's a huge complex (something like 1200 rooms, I guess) and I have never experienced a more consequent display of bad taste and low quality.The room had a bad chemical smell, perhaps from the lino floors or plastic doors and walls. The breakfast buffet was composed by tasteless and lowest quality products. Indeed, a sad and depressing place. As if missing a flight connection wasn't enough!

Reviews.Title: “Big = Good for conferences”
Reviews.Author: Fraser1893
Reviews.Content: Plenty of rooms, conference space, near the airport, late bar. Be careful of the airport shuttle service. On arrival, I had to wait 45 minutes for the service (advertised as every 15 minutes), and on departure, the terminals aren't announced as you arrive. So when someone asked if this was terminal 2 and was told "yes" I was surprised to find that the NEXT stop was terminal 2. I had missed terminal one, and had to take the (non-circular) shuttle to the next terminal, change and get another bus back to terminal 1, wasting about half an hour! Also be aware there's no food except bar snacks before 7pm. And although your room card will say check out is at 12am, don't worry, it's actually at 12pm! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ivan_italy_69
Reviews.Content: A 'great hotel with an' excellent staff. Breakfast is really very good as all the dishes prepared by the excellent chef. Rooms clean and spacious. Ciao to Yolanda ;-). Ivan , Italy

Reviews.Title: “When I really can't find anything else...”
Reviews.Author: MobileJarl
Reviews.Content: Close to the airport is probably the best advantage this hotel has. It can accommodate many guests and has great conference facilities. The rooms where clean but not 'cosy'.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business layover”
Reviews.Author: BenitoMontreal
Reviews.Content: Yes this is a huge hotel, and not a good one if you want to visit Madrid. We chose this hotel on the price (very affordable, including breakfast) and the fact that our customer is a 5 min taxi ride. We usually book in central Madrid, but we were in Madrid just for two days. We used the hotel for sleep, work and one meal. Excellent room (clean, fresh, large), free wired internet in the room, and wireless internet in the lobby. Food at the restaurant is not very good, but good enough for a quick meal. All staff spoke very good English, and were very helpful and courtous. Do not use this hotel if you are a tourist and want to visit anything, it is far from Madrid and there is nothing around the hotel. Excellent for a layover, or a quick business trip if your meeting is in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, but I just love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Quinbus
Reviews.Content: Yes, many of the criticisms elsewhere on this page are true - it's a vast conference-centre hotel in the middle of nowhere (although very convenient for the airport), and if you like to stroll from your hotel to visit local bars, shops and restaurants, forget it: there aren't any. There is however, an excellent restaurant in the hotel, as well as a self-service restaurant and a huge bar with snacks. The rooms are big and comfortable, with spotless bathrooms, a good size desk for working and free wifi which actually works. I stayed here last year during the volcanic cloud affair, and was delighted to see that it hasn't changed. Best of all is the level of service. I walk with a stick and arrived, exhausted, having travelled to the city centre by train from Ciudad Real. Without asking, the receptionist changed my room so that there would be less walking, and a member of staff appeared with a wheelchair to take me up to the room and left me with it in case I needed it again. I had a bar snack and a glass of wine, and bought a bottle to take up to the room... Promptly dropping it on the floor, where it smashed to smithereens. By the time I had straightened up, the barman had already put a replacement bottle on the bar - no charge, even though it was my own stupid fault. No, if you want the bright lights of central Madrid, this is not the place for you. But if you're catching a flight the following morning it is, quite frankly, spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Near the airport - mainly conference center”
Reviews.Author: GwenMagini
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night after we lost our connection to Rome from Lima, Air Europa sent us here - all payed. It's a really big place, mostly for conferences. It's a 10 minutes shuttle ride from the airport, so I guess it's not the best if you want to visit Madrid. Sadly no wifi in the rooms, but cable connection. The beds were not very soft for me, but we were tired, so it wasn't a real problem. It was really quiet, so it was enough. The dinner buffet was good, not excellent, but various.

Reviews.Title: “Airport hotel with little connectivity.”
Reviews.Author: Schloime
Reviews.Content: The airport shuttle was the deciding factor in selecting this hotel and it was a miserable failure. It was unreliable thus causing us to take a taxi in order to get to the airport after it left us cooling our heels over an hour upon arrival. Hotel had poor Internet connectivity and food priced were exhorbitant and no other choices were available at this highway location.

Reviews.Title: “Very unfriendly and unaccomidating”
Reviews.Author: WWTravlerMN
Reviews.Content: To start with we asked for an early check in as our flight from the US was arriving at 7am. When booking the hotel they said it shouldn't be a problem. When we arrived at 9am they said come back in 30 minutes. That soon became 2 hours. Finally, after interrupting the hotels staffs daily gossip one finally gruffly looked into the computer and found a room. Then when needing an iron to iron our clothes for work the next day they would not give us an iron but said we needed to use a service which charged 6.50 Euro per shirt!!!! Not to mention this hotel is no where near Madrid so you need to either pay a hefty taxi ride or take a bus and two train stops to get to the center of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “very strange hotel”
Reviews.Author: fiona229
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the airport but a long and expensive way from teh city centre. It sits on an industrial estate and there is nowhere nearby to walk to. It is absolutely huge. My bedroom was very average. cheap lino floor and a rather weird smell. No tea or coffee making facilities. Lots of odd artefacts in glass cases in the lobby. Almost felt like a film set for a surreal type film Taxi into Madrid was 30 euro. Would not choose to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “I think it has bedbugs.”
Reviews.Author: melanieanne77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the 23rd April and when I went into my room it smelled strongly of chemicals (and smoke). I opened a window and thought it strange that the cleaners would use such a harsh chemical, but I was tired and went to sleep. The next morning I checked out really early 7am. By 7pm that night, I had itchy bites all over my arms and hands. I can only conclude that these are bedbug bites and that the room I was in had been sprayed, however, it had not worked. Not only are these bites itchy, I packed my bag on the bed so I am worried that I have brought them home with me. I stayed on the third floor overlooking the pool. Bed bugs aside, the steak that I ordered from room service was the best steak I have ever eaten - I had it medium rare and it truly was amzaing. Expensive, but worth it. The restaurant is also expenisve but very nice. The cocktails in the cocktail bar werent really worth the 8 Euros. I have emailed th ehotel about the bedbugs and am awaiting a reply. Most disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “A very sad place”
Reviews.Author: S J
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a congress. What a sad place. the minute I arrived i wanted to leave. far from the city center. breakfast area is also very sad. i do not recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Typical airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: nomonomo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very near the Madrid airport; that is, far from the city center. If you have the transportation, it is OK to stay here. Do not expect to go to downtown easily. This is a place to stay on the eve of the departure. The hotel is regularly clean, spacy. Well this is a big convention-center-like hotel. Do not expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive car park”
Reviews.Author: ruckandmaul
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is aparently the largest Hotel in Europe. Our room was on the large side. The bathroom was really nice. No kettle or tea making facilities. Just water in the mini-bar! The room service is crazy prices....8 euros for soup...15 euros for a sandwich! Breakfast is around 19 euros! We walked to the back of the hotel and found a liitle place and paid 18 euros for 3 people! The car park is 21 euros for 7 to 24 hours. which I feel is very expensive. The location is right on the motorway and really difficult to find, even with a sat nav! Our room had free wifi which was great. We paid 110 euros for 1 triple room for 1 night, which is not so god value in my opinion, but had little option because we had to be at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious room near airport”
Reviews.Author: paymogo
Reviews.Content: Air Europa put us up in this hotel after a delay. It's somewhat of a grand hotel — huge and its gigantic halls are museum-like. There's lots of art and sculpture and people were even stopping to take pictures. That said, it's also a little sad, just because it tends to feel somewhat empty because of its size. My room was fabulous. View wasn't great, and it was a bit of a walk from the lobby (the hotel really is that big) but there were gorgeous hardwood floors and an exceptionally comfortable bed. Very, very clean room and bathroom. Bathroom is spacious too. Of course, the downside is that the Auditorium is in the middle of nowhere. It's very close to the airport, of course. But no clue how you would get to the center from here sans taxi. The airline gave us a free buffet at the hotel's dining hall. Food was decent. Service here is fine but no one is what I would call friendly, exactly. Took forever to get a drink at the bar, even though it was rather empty. But I wasn't going anywhere, so I suppose it didn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks USAirways for putting us up in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: garycaspelich
Reviews.Content: We had a chance to stay at this hotel when we were bumped from our flight home. This is the hotel in Madrid where most of the airlines put up their bumped passengers. We were given a very spacious room to stay and exchanged our $7 meal vouchers for all you can eat and drink buffet. All you can eat seafood, paeila, beef (lots of beef) and all you can drink water and wine. We ate the lunch buffet and I pretty much wanted to pass out but instead took the airport van to the airport and took the metro from the airport to downtown Madrid. This hotel is mainly used for conferences and at the time an HP conference was taking place.Dinner was even more amazing and lasted till 11PM. We were seated at a table with more bumped passengers from Mallorca and talked about life around the world, drank more wine and ate shrimp (prawns) bigger than my hand. The folks from Mallorca said these were average size and they have larger at their island. I would love to get bumped and stay at this hotel. Otherwise way too out of the way from downtown Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “it's close to the airport - that's all!”
Reviews.Author: tanagogo1
Reviews.Content: Oh what a disappointment. Travelled to Madrid for a week long business meeting and could not believe it when we saw the hotel. thought it was some kind of mistake. Stuck in a time warp in the 1970s with dreadful tired decor and poor rooms. No wireless facilities in rooms. Didnt take my socks off in the room all week.

Reviews.Title: “sometimes the stuff makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: georgiapa1985
Reviews.Content: A very very nice clean spacious hotel,with so many to provide to its every customer,but with a HUGE disadvantage, apart from 2 ladies at the reception,nobody else spoke English. So it was impossible for a non Spanish- speaking customer to communicate in any way. Moreover, the waiters were rude and unfriendly. So, if you speak Spanish i would probably recommend this hotel to you but if you don't, think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roquete76
Reviews.Content: Overall an average experience at best. Rooms are quite large but need renovation. Beds are spacious for European standards but mattresses are uncomfortable. Hotel is massive and clearly a congress hotel. I would not recommend staying here as a private customer. Breakfast was ok, however the rest of the food was rather poor. Public transportation to the city center takes about an hour. Taxi is usually faster (depending on traffic) and around 30 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: kalimocho
Reviews.Content: Preliminary: Rack rate for a standard twin room is € 200,-, breakfast is 17,- extra, lunch/dinner buffet costs 25,- ea., parking is 21,-/day. Booking over the internet can result in substantial cut-offs. Location: at the edge of a major speedway and very close to the main runway of Madrid airport. Definintely not a place to stay except for plane connex and attending fairs. No pets. Transport: complimentary shuttle to all airport teminals and IFEMA fair grounds. Public buses to city (pay driver) stop at front door. Lobby and public areas are luxury decorated, plenty of space. Rooms are very quiet, carpeted, tidy, spacious, and have 2 queen size beds,TV, working desk, phone, minibar, safe (extra charge), bath with full size tub and shower. Restaurants: a huge place (Salon Madrid) is used for breakfast and main meals from the buffet. Tables are placed very close together, and the many busy waiters running around all the time don't make one feel comfortable. There is a smaller and quieter restaurant "a la carte", 3 bars to choose from - prices are rather high. Hint: there is a small cafeteria outside behind the hotel where you get good deals on food and drinks. Amenities: indoor pool, tennis courts, games room with online betting. Free WiFi throughout the hotel. Avis car rental desk. Room service avilable from early morning to midnight. Reception staff is friendly and helpful. Buffet waiters take their time. Very good bang for the buck if you book ahead and don't stay on walk-in rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, museum quality lobby”
Reviews.Author: mwarn01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night, wish we could have stayed longer. It was great having a large comfortable bed instead oft two small pushed together. The hotel room was very large with a big bathroom. The highlight of our trip was the museum antique quality furnishings in the lobby. Breakfast was great and the staff helpful, We used the shuttle to go to and from the airport, it arrives every 30 min. No reservations were needed. Minor negatives: 1.Location good, but a trip to get into town and the surrounding area in need of mowing and industrial. Plug behind the TV hanging of the wall. 2. Wake up call never happened, we missed the shuttle but another came 15 min. later. A staff member took our photo while we waited and drooled over the antiques.

Reviews.Title: “Most Insulting and Rudest Customer Service I have ever found”
Reviews.Author: Errants
Reviews.Content: Auditorium Madrid was one of the worst hotel experience I had. When I booked online, I booked a room with breakfast and parking included. When I checked in, I was told the breakfast and parking were not included. I showed the staff the email confirmation and then they turn very hostile though just a few minutes later they had to accept the evidences. I thought this was a dishonest measure to attract customers online but not delivering as promised. Futhermore I asked to they reception desk to bring to my room some ice cubes, they told me I should have to pick up it to the restaurant to get them otherwise they will charge me 3 euros. Probably I will tip the same amount to the delivery boy: it sounds too mean to me. Moreover as this hotel are in the middle of nowhere and the bar and restaurant are incredibly expensive, I ordered some food from a pizza delivery service. After over one hour I called again and they told me that the hotel staff don't allow him to enter in the hotel to deliver the food. By the way, the phone calls to order the pizza were outrageously expensive. This was a most unpleasant experience I had with any hotel in any city. Also, the staff were rude, unkind, hostile, aggresive and not responsive to questions. Regarding the free shuttle service is absolutely useless if your flight times are around 6.00 am because the shuttle service begins around 5.00 am

Reviews.Title: “carboard beds”
Reviews.Author: koshousk
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel from hotwire to be close to airport for our next day flight on our last day in madrid. Hotwire said it was a 4 star hotel. Place is like a huge anciet hotel with shabby decor. when we got to hotel no reservation on file. had to call hotwire to fax over reseravtion finally got to room just to find an awful view of the roof stained carpet and dirty windows. complained and was moved to bldg 1 3fl rm 64. view was nothing special as it faced airport but mouch better than previous room. finally went to sleep and beds were hard as bricks literrally. I think we were better off sleeping on a cardboard box at the airport. neverhte less don't stay here no matter the situation.

Reviews.Title: “near the airport”
Reviews.Author: SailingPT
Reviews.Content: Decoration from the 80's, breakfast good

Reviews.Title: “Customer service very rude”
Reviews.Author: Leonor59
Reviews.Content: We choose this Hotel because they have a shuttle from and to the airportt, yes we did not have to wait to long for the Shuttle when we arrived, the problem was when we where going back to the airport, we where waiting( around 10 people) for the shuttle at the door of the hotel, when the Lady park the shuttle, she was still sitting like waiting so I decided to open the back door for all of us to start putting our luggage, at that moment this lady start screeming and asking me if a was the owner of the shuttle that who authorized me to open the door, I apologized and told her that she did not need to screen at me, and she keep going and told me that I will not ride on her shuttle that look for a taxi, that's when I decide to talk to a superior. This lady I think her name is Ana she is so unprofesional, and very RUDE.

Reviews.Title: “Not for business trip! Too much tourists”
Reviews.Author: Julienchito
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located 10 drive from the airport and offers lift from the airport. Depending on the management staff they could be very helpful or very arrogant. The rooms are clean but far to be modern or renovated. The internet is free in the hotel. Rooms doesn't have WI-FI but cable connection. All bars have WI-FI connection. The breakfast is too pricey for what it offers. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel for business trip. This hotel is too big and too much tourists. I had the impression to be in the airport main hall instead of an hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Auditorium or Museum ?”
Reviews.Author: changs
Reviews.Content: This is really a hotel of a huge scale - consisting of four spacious blocks of rooms and must be about 50 meeting rooms. The rooms are quite spacious and well furnished, with a prompt room service. The hotel food quality and services are quite top class at a very affordable price. Moreover they have a frequent pick up drop service from and to Airport, which is complementary. What impressed me most was their fantastic collection of exquisite sculptures and paintings. The collections may put even a museum to shame. There is a nice bar in the lobby - the ideal place for football and golf lovers to enjoy the game on big screen. In short, I really enjoyed my 1 week stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay although they do know how to charge for meals!”
Reviews.Author: YARONMaidenhead
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Auditorium Madrid Hotel in April 2010 and as a smoker we did have a smoking room. It was nice, clean and welcoming. The reception staff were lovely and couldnt do enough for us. The Buffet restaurant was laid out very nice and the food delicious. However the waiters were a bit rude.

Reviews.Title: “before you book at this hotel...book in CENTRAL MADRID ...PERIOD”
Reviews.Author: sohaif
Reviews.Content: My wife & I travel alot as she has those free tickets so we decided to visit Madrid for the weekend. Hotel Location....in a area with nothing around it just commercial properties. No TRAINS , a bus stop which is OK but if you stay in Central Madrid near SOL you save time & money on travel...thats make SENSE Staff...Very POOR service...we called for an iron ...they dont keep irons you got to pay 6 euros for each piece of garment to be ironed...thats absurd Their website says COMPLIMENTRY BUS to City.... a LIE front desk says we stopped it...why..ok take it off your website then. Hotel has a smell old...decor is too overwhleming art decor meets new meets tradiional. My wife is the picky one but i complained on this more than her...oh yeah no shower curtain in tub a half door glass which does not control water that drips over the floor. I am expecting a FULL REFUND pretty soon.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, could do with teaching the staff some manners though”
Reviews.Author: 050810a
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with work quite a bit as I worked at Barajas airport. The hotel is huge and breakfast is fantastic, with a small pool for those sunny days. However, I would like to complain about the staff. Breakfast was lovely, but one lady in particular kept taking half full drinks from people and if you dared ask for a second sugar with your coffee, you feel as if you have committed a crime. The rude lady also took away our plates while we were still eating. In the bar, I ordered an ice cream and told the gentleman to put it on my room. As I finished my icecream and went to my room, the receptionist grabbed me and started shouting, accusing me of stealing. I didn't know what she was on about but she said i had took an ice cream without paying. I explained that I charged it to my room and she said 'you are on company business, you cannot charge things to the room'. I finally got another staff member out to back me up but the sourfaced 'lady' didn't apologise. It's a shame these women let the hotel down, my work colleagues even have more stories. This is a grand hotel and would be so much better with new staff.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Runija
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel overnight as our flight back to the UK was cancelled at short notice. Check in was slow as there were only 2 staff on duty, however they worked as fast as they could and were very courteous. My room was huge, unfortunately I got a room at the front of the hotel overlooking the main carriageway and it was NOISY!!! The bed was hard, but thats not necessarily always a bad thing, but it was the traffic noise all night that kept me awake! But the room and bathroom were extremely clean and comfortable. We had buffet dinner on arrival and there was a good selection on offer and the desserts were lovely. We relaxed in a bar at the front of the hotel afterwards and listened to a pianist playing some background music. Breakfast the next morning was fabulous, service was quick and courteous. The hotel is 5 mins from the airport and less than 20 mins from Madrid city centre. It's a huge busy hotel, with lots of tourists coming and going. Apart from the noisy road, I didn't have a bad experience and would recommend it for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worst location ever!”
Reviews.Author: AVDude
Reviews.Content: First off, let me saw I am an a seasoned American business traveler. The bad: This hotel is located next to the airport and in an industrial park. There is absolutely NOTHING in walking distance from this hotel. Decor is a bizarre mismash of modern mixed with old. Areas of the hotel smell like mothballs and candle wax. Beds are hard as plywood. Food choices are expensive and limited. No sundries shop. Terrible coffee. The good: The breakfast buffet is decent and thankfully was included on our room rate. Internet was free. You can catch a bus across the street from the hotel and ride into downtown Madrid in about 40 mins.

Reviews.Title: “check your belongings before you check out!”
Reviews.Author: minoupisci
Reviews.Content: I was in Madrid to visit a trade fair IFEMA. I stayed in this hotel for 4 days. Upon arrival, the receptionist assigned me with a smoker room without asking about my prefrences. the room was at the end of this very large hotel and I had to go back to reception desk to ask for a different room and I was not welcome to ask so! They were not guest friendly. After I returned to Bucharest where I live, I noticed by unpacking that one of my shoulder bags I had taken with me on this trip was missing. I immediatedly called the hotel to report this and I did this for the next 3 days but every person I talked to kept telling me that they have cameras everywhere and there is nothing on the tapes! By this date, I have no feedback about my bag.

Reviews.Title: “OK for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: SwedenBell
Reviews.Content: After that I missed a flight I was put in this hotel for an overnight stay. I thought that it was a fantastic hotel for a night, but I don’t know if it’s any good for going back and forward to Madrid centre. It’s located near the airport. Room – nice and clean but only view to big motor roads on both sides of the hotel. Thin walls to corridor, you hear people coming and going with luggage all night. Service – only checked in and out but receptionist spoke good English and were nice and helpful. Food – dinner buffet was good with nice food and many choices. Breakfast also buffet with loads of food. But in the morning when the breakfast room was full it turned in to a rat race. The room is huge and hundreds of people are trying to find tables and food, very stressful. Bar – nice located in the reception area but staff was helpful and price of drinks decent. Also another smaller bar were you were aloud to smoke. Turned into a gas chamber after a while. At least for a night or two this hotel is ok. It gets a few extra points for its luxuries first floor and cool interior design.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: kceesse
Reviews.Content: I agree with pretty much most of the previous reviews Pros - Cheap prices - Great breakfast buffet with lots of choices - Frequent Shuttle to airport - Very fast and complimentary internet - No bellboys/bell captains Cons - A very large hotel with no sense of style and grandeur - everything is linear, dark and just very 1960s Russia like - Very poor service - they only had 2 staff for check-in for a crowd of around 50, and it took 20 minutes to check-in - Restaurant/bar service equally poor with staff that just seem disinterested to work.. from waiting 20 minutes for a menu, to orders being forgotten and staff having a hard time understanding English - Wake up calls that were late or did not happen at all - The hallway goes dark when no one passes by it for a certain amount of time - so the hotel is pretty dark and depressing at timees - Beds are quite hard - Showers water pressure very weak - and the lack of shower curtain and the bathroom floor gets wet easily - Poor views, or rather non-existent views for most of the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Interserco
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had to spend one night in Madrid to take our next flight out the following day. We had to wait for 1 1/2 hrs. for the hotel bus!! after calling three times and screaming for service! each time I called, I was told that it would take only 5 more minutes for driver to go pick us up. All vans for all hotels came by 4 and 5 times, while we were still waiting for ours. It was close to 11:30 PM by the time the van finally arrived. We were tired and had only a few hours to sleep before leaving the following day. Hotel Auditorium took time away from our time to rest, whch is the purpose we got a hotel room in the first place. What is worse is that by the time the van showed up, it wasn't just us waiting, but other furious guests too. Many people were questioning the driver and she got furious to the point that she did not load our baggage into the van. We had to do it ourselves and same thing when we arrived at the hotel!!! I've traveled around the world and stayed at many hotels, I never had to go through this before. When we finally arrived in our room, my daughter discovered two hairs on the sheet of her bed!!!! I guess they don't wash the sheets between guests, or who knows what they do!!! They may be a good value, but when it comes to service, it's another story! PLEASE DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL! AVOID THE AGGRAVATION, POOR SERVICE AND POOR CUSTOMER APPRECIATION!!

Reviews.Title: “Not great not terrible just OK”
Reviews.Author: wicorthered
Reviews.Content: Only major downside was the location.Shuttle service into the city was too infrequent, although the service to the airport was very good. Would have liked the shuttle to have run later last bus back to the hotel was too early in the evening. In the evening time there was very little to do in the hotel so going into the city was a must!! Wouldn't recommend it to people traveling to Madrid for the nitelife i'd prefer next time to spend more on a central location. Hotel itself was very clean and the rooms of a good standard. Prices compared with restaurants in the city. If your traveling alone stay away it's definitely aimed at people in groups.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: aroundthisworld
Reviews.Content: Big hotel, nice rooms. Central to the airport with a free shuttle running to the terminals. The hotel lies along the motorway, so once you are at the hotel you need a taxi or to take the bus to get anywhere. Unless you want to walk along the road. The bus stop is just outside the hotel, which is helpful. Almost always a taxi waiting outside the hotel, as most taxis in Madrid the price depends on the taxi driver. Even though there is a meter in the taxi and the price should be about the same. The hotel has a swimming pool and a gym. For short stay and business the hotel is ok. If you are there for a weekend leisure trip, the location will probably put you off.

Reviews.Title: “I really dislike this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A319
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Auditorium several times, all of which were enforced on me by my employer. I find the hotel depressing: it is situated at the side of a motorway and there is nothing around it apart from industrial buildings. The hotel is massive and impersonal. The staff are OK though, as is breakfast. I can't think of anything else to say about is: blandness is difficult to write about.

Reviews.Title: “Russian style building”
Reviews.Author: ZandaSpain
Reviews.Content: Overnighting at this hotel (room 64 block 3) ready for a flight to Canada the next morning. Russian block building was rather souless from outside, but step inside and it was full of clocks and French antiques. Surprising, but I couldn´t understand why the hotel had this theme. The beds were so hard I hardly slept, and had backache for days after, Staff were efficient and the breakfast buffet included was very good. Food in the restaurant was way too expensive so we went to a shopping mall not far away and ate there.

Reviews.Title: “pathetic attempt at quality”
Reviews.Author: worriedLondon
Reviews.Content: This Hotel suggests that it has a 4 star rating. Not in my wildest imaginings would this inept joke qualify in anyone’s rating system as even a single star. The hotel boasts that it the largest in Europe and close to Airport. Let’s make a start on its short comings. Location 1) It is close to an airport but not the main one. The main airport is a 20 Euro taxi ride away. 2) It is in the middle of a particularly ugly industrial complex with motorway on one side and dual carriageway on the other, and bracketed by lorry parks. 3) It is a long, long, long way from Madrid centre and will cost anywhere between 20 and 35 euro's to get to Centre. 4) There are absolutely no amenities external to the Hotel whatsoever. Amenities 1) The hotel is a block design with approx 250 rooms per block (3 blocks) over 4 floors. Each block only has two small lifts serving it and No easily accessible stairs. Lifts are busy at all times of day and stairs are not an option. Fire escapes are external at the end of each block and are alarmed so cannot be used except in an emergency. 2) The gym is small and equipment is poor quality. At no point was any advice on equipment use available or offered. 3) Being totally isolated means that eating and drinking has to be done within the Hotel. They have made full use of this monopoly by making the most outrageous charges for everything. 4) Breakfast is akin to Butlins circa 1960 5) Staffing levels are always inadequate and ever single aspect where staff client interaction has to be undertaken is a nightmare scenario. 6) This is supposed to be an international conference centre and hotel. Only a tiny proportion of staff has another language other than Spanish. Staff were generally uncooperative, surly and lazy. There simply is not enough room here to list every aspect where this awful, awful place failed to meet even the most basic requirements for a quality hotel. Avoid this place at all costs, it is overpriced, overrated and overhyped. I have stayed in better youth Hostels in third world countries than this hapless woebegone hell hole. Do not be fooled by mediocre reviews this place must be avoided at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “good for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: touristuro
Reviews.Content: The big plus for this hotel is that it has a free shuttle service to the airport. The room I had was spacious, clean and air-conditioned with tv and a good sized double bed. I had booked room only via the internet but I did take advantage of the buffet and breakfast. Buffet cost 30 euros which incuded a bottle each of wine and water. The buffet was excellent as was breakfast which cost just over 18 euros. Front desk staff all spoke English. Bar staff were quick and efficient. Sit down at a table and you were served almost immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel with little atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: UK_FlyGuy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a number of times, ranging from a one night stay to over a week. The hotel is huge, with many identical corridors and landings. The rooms are similarly large and well appointed, with comfortable beds, large bathrooms and all the usual amenities. As this hotel is very much geared towards the business traveller, each room has free wired internet access with free wireless also available in most areas. The views aren't exactly inspiring, though each room does have a large window. Food and drink is really quite expensive and nothing to get too excited about in the Lobby Bar, though spirits are very generously poured. The entire hotel seems quite quiet, except during conferences when the vast halls fill up. The breakfast room, following the theme, is huge with a great selection and the obligatory toaster that doesn't really toast much at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.”
Reviews.Author: MegsChatt
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Auditorium worked pretty decently for us. The airport shuttle was very convenient, and the primary reason for our choice. Getting into the city center isn't as difficult as others have said, as long as you're willing to remember that you're in a foreign country and perhaps you should try public transportation. There is a bus stop directly in front of the hotel, and though we had to take a bus to the metro and the metro into the center (a total of 1 hour), it was well worth the convenience of the hotel to the airport and still allowed for an enjoyable evening in the city. The room was nice. We asked for a quiet room, and I'm certain we were the only guests on the entire hallway (it is an enormously large hotel). No reason to pay the extra expense for breakfast, just pick up something quick at the airport-- remember, you're in Europe! Do as the Europeans do-- a quick cafe con leche, a pastry, and you're set.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel looked our rooms ( 40 passengers ) we called the police, DEC 22”
Reviews.Author: Vojislaw
Reviews.Content: I hope some of the passengers form the flights cancelled on DEc to London gatwick, can read this , after easyjets said that it will pay for two nights, the Lady from the reception desk ( lets called her that way) Maria you know who you are, hoping you will get the warehouse packing job that you derserve soon,inform us at 7 pm , that if we want to stay we need to pay... after that. - The hotel looked all the rooms, not opportunity to take our things or wallets. -Some kids need it medication that was in the room. - We called the police Nobody form the Hotel taking responsability, I am filing a formal complint against this Hotel and easyjet. An employee named Sergio told that " I have to eat it" Christmas mood, and they said that nobody can have dinner INCREDIBLE Edwards Dos Santos

Reviews.Title: “Less of a dump than others”
Reviews.Author: Samba75
Reviews.Content: Fourth business trip to Madrid and our office next to the airport. Fourth different hote - the first three hotels I refuse to go back to (High Tech, Melia & NH) as they are dirty, falling down, dumps with Rude staff. The Auditorium is only a dirty dump with Absent staff. The price was OK, a little expensive for what it was - but I'd happily pay the double for a decent quality international hotel where the staff 1) Speak English 2) Speak to Guests So I suppose I'll go back, but only because it is less foul than the others and I can't deal with Madrid traffic and Madrid Taxi Drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you have to”
Reviews.Author: Tagesthemen
Reviews.Content: This is a big depressing hotel full of people who do not really want to stay there staffed by people who do not really want to work there. My excuse was that I was participating in a conference in the hotel. Although an airport hotel, it is really in the middle of a grey industrial zone. The airport shuttle is good to get to the airport but if you want to get into the city forget it. If you do use it, it does not even take you right into the centre of the city. I used the gym but several machines were not working and did not even have "out of order" signs. The whole feeling of the hotel is weird - from the view of the bright green astroturf from my bedroom window to the massive breakfast room. The positives were that the room was quite spacious and the room rate was not that expensive, and I could walk downstairs to the conference. If you are in Madrid on holidays, do yourself a favour and do not stay here.
