Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay at the Auditorium Again”
Reviews.Author: Papilia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Spain for the first time on our honeymoon in Oct. 07. We were spending 1 day/night in Madrid before driving down south to the Andalucia region. Our original hotel was Sercotel Hotel Lusso Infantas booked through Orbitz and was right in the city center. While boarding our flight, Orbitz called me and informed me our original hotel was overbooked and we were being moved to a sister hotel which was the Hotel Auditorium Madrid. Online, the hotel is listed as being only 2 kilometers from the airport. After a $50 cab ride we found out the the hotel is 2 kilometers from the "old airport" but 22 kilometers from the new airport so be aware of that. This hotel is FAR from the center of the city and no where near a metro line. We felt stranded without a car. They do have a shuttle bus that takes you to the metro and the airport but these buses are small and do not run often enough. There are many more people wanting to get on than can fit. People were actually arguing over who would get a seat. We wasted a lot of our 1 day in Madrid trying to get on one of these shuttles. If you do want to take advantage of this services arrive at the designated spot 20 minutes early to insure a seat. While the Hotel Auditorium was clean, the overall service and friendliness was lacking. The staff was not very nice and we were offered no compensation from either hotel for our trouble, not even a complimentary breakfast. I guess if you have a car, it wouldn't be so bad but the place was large and really lacking any charm. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: KeitCauvin
Reviews.Content: Sent by BA & Iberia. What a souless place! Ate a dull buffet in the corner of a dining room the size of a football pitch. Hotel is full of faded kitsch furniture - but still feels empty- and unless you get a taxi into town, you are trapped - there is nothing else. I rememember walking about half a mile inside to find the smoking area. Iberia - por favor, busca otro hotel para sus clientes.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Room Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: nsoctraveler
Reviews.Content: Ok. You guys need to calm down. I am still in the hotel and am leaving in the morning. I cam in with a very low expectation after reading all the bad reviews. But I'll say that if you are looking for a nice place to stay, then the hotel is excellent. I checked in and came in my room not knowing that I had to insert the key on a light activator to light the room. So I ask the from desk why the lights were not working and they explained politely what I needed to do. It worked. I then checked out the bathroom. It was amazing to see that they had everything I would need: shaving cream, after shave, free cologne, two toothbrushes, toothpaste, razor blade, shower gel, soap, comb, etc... more than I have had in all the 5 stars hotels in the U.S. They even had free shoe polish and a hand sewing kit. Free internet access in the room, wired and wireless. Bring your CAT5 or network cable in case wireless signal is weak. I did not use their restaurant or other services but the room is perfect. Oh, yes they use half size glass for bathtub but that's the least of my concerns.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel Madrid”
Reviews.Author: MXvoyager1
Reviews.Content: this hotel is nice, maybe one of the largest in Madrid, it is close to Barajas airport, but far from City center, good enough but for the same price you can get better place nearby the downtown, service is ok, internet cable-dsl is free but with little failures (bring your rj45). Restaurant service is ok, food is great, even the buffet is ok, staff people at front desk always try to help you. they have shuttle to and from airport and shuttle to Av. de las Americas transport station free. I have it as last minute hotel due a failure with my airline but I like it, maybe i will stay again for an overnight nearby the airport.

Reviews.Title: “OK until...”
Reviews.Author: thehappyfew
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were sent there after missing our connection. The hotel is clean, and the staff was polite and helpful, especially considering they receive mostly angry passengers from practically every airline. When asked in a friendly way, one of them even directed me to the best flamenco place in Madrid, among a myriad tips I would have never found otherwise. The location is totally out of the way if you want to go downtown, and the free shuttle bus goes there only about every two hours. The buffet was fine, repetitive bout good quality, until I found a fly in the mayonaisse. The maitre freaked out and I think someone in the kitchen became unemployed.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go there again”
Reviews.Author: bXMi
Reviews.Content: Location: Close to the airport, free shuttle leaving to and from the hotel quite frequently. If you are going downtown, this is definately not the hotel to stay at. The hotel is huge, but the interior is outdated and looks like a mess - lots of gold surfaces and cheap, old imitations of clockworks and vases. There is even an artwork of a fully sized broken Cadillac, not really something that belongs in an entrance. Can be difficult to find rooms because the hallwas look pretty much the same in different areas of the hotel. Room: Spacious, clean rooms with comfortable beds. There is absolutely no view since the hotel is a bunker by the freeway. Meals: Large buffet, but mediocre food for lunch. Breakfast was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “It is...weird!”
Reviews.Author: Richard H
Reviews.Content: I was there with 1000 other guests for a congress. It's located next to the airport and free shutles every half an hour or so. Far from the centre of Madrid, took us 30 min by taxi, so if you're in the city for holiday, romantic trip or other leisure act. don't book this one. It's big, dark and kinda twin peaks, if you now what I mean. Cheap looking lobby. Every evening there was a problem with my keycard, but it was taken care of efficiently. Staff was neutral. Nice breakfast, had to wait a bit for coffee, but there were a lot of guests. Room service was fast, the meal was still hot when I got it. Minibar, clean room, nice bathroom. Stayed in a standard double. There is absoulutely nothing to do in this hotel if you have some spare time, but not enough to go to the city centre, no gym, no internetcafe - they do have a bar with a wide choice of spanish reds. Only a few english speaking tv-channels.

Reviews.Title: “Odd hotel”
Reviews.Author: tgl
Reviews.Content: This is a very odd hotel. I stayed there for a conference. It is located on a busy expressway and is quite unattractive from the road and from the side (conference facility) entrance. The airport and downtown are in two directions. Taxi rides to both are about 12-15 euros. There is no subway or outside restaurant within reasonable walking distance. The shuttle service was inconsistent. There was four times an hour pick up at the airport, but the shuttle took a different route each time so one usually waited longer than 15 minutes. Unfortunately, going to the airport was the fastest way to get to the subway. The service at the front desk was polite and slow. At check in, my clerk and the adjent clerk were both unaware that they could exchange money. After searching for a manager for 10 minutes they exchanged money at a quite unfavorable rate. The ATM around the corner in the hotel hall was much cheaper. The rooms are furnished with bed, desk, chairs, entertainment center/dresser. My room was somewhat dim. The dark furniture made it seem darker. There was no iron or ironing board although there was a price list for ironing--6 euros for a shirt. The exercise facility was enormous, dark and contained one exercise bike. The pool was old and required a swimming cap. Breakfast was a vast array of preserved meats and fish along with a smaller choice of pastries and fruit. Service for coffee and juice was slow and inattentive. Lunch was specially arrange by my conference because there is usually no lunch. There are no restaurants in the hotel open during the day. There is a bar. A 4 oz soda was 3 euros, a bit steep even for Europe. Service in the bar area was erratic. The one outstanding feature of this hotel was the conference facility. After seeing the room at my colleagues hotel, I wished I had elected to stay at an outlying hotel rather than the main conference hotel. The only reason to stay at this hotel is if it is where your conference is located. Otherwise, I would have stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but distant”
Reviews.Author: alvipan
Reviews.Content: This is a big airport hotel, it's out of city, but seems clean and confortable. We stayed there because our flight was cancelated. The breakfast is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Soulless and unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: LighterMe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Auditorium for a conference and find it hard to say anything positive about this place. The location is too far out of town with only few shuttle bus runs or a public bus which takes you to the metro, taxis are around 20 euros each way. There are no coffee making facilities in the rooms and nowhere to buy a bottle of water unless you count a minute bottle from the expensive mini-bar. At the drinks reception it took five tries to get a glass of wine. The welcome dinner takes place in a brightly lit hall the size of a football pitch with the same choice of food being dished up for dinner, breakfast and lunch. We found the bar staff to be rude with lots of rolled up eyes and tut-tutting. Considering this hotel must be used by conference organisers a great deal, the sound quality was poor and the doors could do with oiling. The room was okay, nothing special, but with hair balls in the plugholes..... This is a huge, impersonal hotel not at all suited to the needs of tourists, one night's stay is enough even as a business traveller.
